courses_list.course_description: The Fundamentals of Programming with Code.org class provides an introduction to block-based programming using Code.org, an easy-to-use educational platform.

The Basic Scratch (2-3) course introduces younger students to block-based programming using the Scratch platform. The curriculum is split into two 8-week courses and students should take both Part 1 and Part 2.
This class introduces students to the basics of block-based programming through creating games in Scratch. It serves as a bridge to learning about text-based programming languages such as Python.
This course introduces students to the basics of Python, a text-based programming language that is widely used. Students do not need to have experience with programming to take the class.

The Web Design with HTML/CSS class introduces students to the use of HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) and CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) to design websites. Students do not need experience with web design to enroll in this course.
